Module com.example.demo
Package com.example.demo.actor.plane

Class BossPlane

java.lang.Object
javafx.scene.Node
javafx.scene.image.ImageView
com.example.demo.actor.ActiveActor
com.example.demo.actor.plane.FighterPlane
com.example.demo.actor.plane.BossPlane
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget
public class BossPlane extends FighterPlane
The BossPlane class represents a specialized type of FighterPlane with an additional shield capability. It extends the FighterPlane class and adds functionality for initializing and managing a shield. The shield has a probability of being active, defined by the BOSS_SHIELD_PROBABILITY constant.

This class includes methods for constructing a BossPlane, initializing its shield, performing additional updates to the shield, checking if the plane is shielded, and applying damage to the plane. If the shield is active, the plane does not take damage.

See Also:

      Constructs a new BossPlane with the specified configuration and actor spawner.
      Parameters:
      config - the configuration for the plane
      actorSpawner - the actor spawner used to initialize the shield

      protected void performAdditionalUpdates(long now)
      Performs additional updates, specifically updating the shield.
      Overrides:
      performAdditionalUpdates in class FighterPlane
      Parameters:
      now - The current time in nanoseconds.

    • isShielded

      public boolean isShielded()
      Checks if the BossPlane is currently shielded.
      Returns:
      True if the shield is active, false otherwise.

    • takeDamage

      public boolean takeDamage()
      Applies damage to the BossPlane. If the BossPlane is shielded, no damage is taken.
      Overrides:
      takeDamage in class FighterPlane
      Returns:
      True if the BossPlane took damage, false otherwise.
